revision.text:
{{wiktionary|DNA|dna|deoxyribonucleic|deoxyribonucleic acid|deoxyribose nucleic acid}} {{TOC right}} In biochemistry, '''[[DNA]]''' (deoxyribonucleic acid) is a molecule encoding the genetic instructions for life.
'''DNA''' may also refer to: * [[Z-DNA]], one of the possible double helical structures of DNA
==Books== * ''[[D.N.Angel]]'', 2003 manga/anime franchise by Yukiru Sugisaki * DnA, [[Dan Abnett]] and Andy Lanning<!-- wikilink removed, DnA not mentioned in Andy Lanning's article -->, British comic book writing duo's joint pen name * DNA, 2008 book by [[Dennis Kelly]] * ''[[DNA²]]'', 1993 manga by Masakazu Katsura, subsequently adapted into an anime ===Periodicals=== * ''[[Daily News and Analysis]]'', Indian broadsheet newspaper * ''[[DNA Magazine]]'' Australian monthly magazine * ''[[Les Dernières Nouvelles d'Alsace]]'' (''Les DNA''), daily French newspaper
==Film and TV== * [[DNA (1997 film)|''DNA'' (1997 film)]], an American science fiction action film * [[DNA (2020 film)|''DNA'' (2020 film)]], a French drama film * [[DNA (Red Dwarf)|"DNA" (''Red Dwarf'')]], 1991 British sci-fi comedy TV episode * [[DNA (TV series)|''DNA'' (TV series)]], British television crime drama
==Music== ===Bands=== * [[DNA (American band)]], No Wave band * [[DNA (duo)]], electronic dance music duo * [[Dna (Greek Musical Collective)]], band and music composers * DNA, rock band formed in 1983 by [[Rick Derringer]] and Carmine Appice * DNA, an upcoming four-member Kazakh boy group under [[Juz Entertainment]]
===Albums=== * ''DNA'', 2019 album by [[Jeanette Biedermann]] * ''[[DNA (Last Live at CBGB's)]]'' 1993 album by DNA * [[D.N.A. (John Foxx album)|''D.N.A.'' (John Foxx album)]], 2010 * [[DNA_(Koda_Kumi_album)|''DNA'' (Koda Kumi album)]], 2018 * [[DNA (Little Mix album)|''DNA'' (Little Mix album)]], 2012 * [[D.N.A. (Mario album)|''D.N.A.'' (Mario album)]], 2009 * [[DNA (Matthew Shipp and William Parker album)|''DNA'' (Matthew Shipp and William Parker album)]], 1999 * [[DNA (Trapt album)|''DNA'' (Trapt album)]], 2016 * [[DNA (Wanessa Camargo album)|''DNA'' (Wanessa Camargo album)]], 2011 * [[DNA (Ian Yates album)|''DNA'' (Ian Yates album)]], 2014 * [[DNA (Backstreet Boys album)|''DNA'' (Backstreet Boys album)]], 2019
===Songs=== * [[DNA (BTS song)|"DNA" (BTS song)]], 2017 * [[DNA (Empire of the Sun song)|"DNA" (Empire of the Sun song)]], 2013 * [[D.N.A. (A Flock of Seagulls song)|"D.N.A." (A Flock of Seagulls song)]], 1982 * [[DNA (Kendrick Lamar song)|"DNA" (Kendrick Lamar song)]], 2017 * [[DNA (Little Mix song)|"DNA" (Little Mix song)]], 2012 * "DNA", a song by Danny Brown from his album ''[[XXX (Danny Brown album)|XXX]]'' * "DNA", a song by The Kills on their album ''[[Blood Pressures]]'' * "DNA", a song by Rye Rye from her album ''[[Go! Pop! Bang!]]'' * "DNA", a song by Wale from his album ''[[Shine (Wale album)|Shine]]''
==Computing== * [[BitTorrent DNA]], download accelerator * [[Celemony Software#DNA Direct Note Access|Direct Note Access]], technology for manipulation of individual notes within chords and polyphonic recordings * [[DNA computing]], field of non-silicon computing technologies based on molecular biology * [[DIGITAL Network Architecture]], DECnet's peer-to-peer networking architecture * [[Windows DNA]], defunct predecessor of the Microsoft {{not a typo|.NET}} Framework
==Organisations== ===Companies=== * [[DNA Productions]], American animation studio * [[DNA Studio]], advertising agency * [[DNA Oyj]], Finnish telecommunications company * [[DNA Films]], British film studio * [[DNA Publications]], American publishing company
===Politics and government=== * [[Democratic National Assembly]], political party in Trinidad and Tobago * {{lang|no|Det norske Arbeiderparti}} or the [[Norwegian Labour Party]] * [[National Anticorruption Directorate|Direcția Națională Anticorupție]] (National Anticorruption Directorate), Romanian anti-corruption agency *[[FloraNT|DNA]] (Index herbariorum code for Northern Territory Herbarium at Palmerston in the Northern Territory)
==Other uses== * [[Corporate DNA]], factors underlying and affecting organizational culture * [[DNA Lounge]], nightclub in San Francisco, California, U.S. * [[Dynamic network analysis]], emergent scientific field in sociology and statistics * [[Dynamic New Athletics]], a team competition format in athletics * [[Glossary of motorsport terms#D|Did Not Attend]], in motorsports * [[DNa inscription]], an ancient inscription at the tomb of Darius the Great
==See also== * [[DNA profiling]] * [[DeNA]], mobile provider in Japan * [[DNAR]] or "Do not attempt resuscitation", legal order to withhold cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) or cardiac life support
{{Disambiguation}}
